text:
<https://app.slack.com/team/U015C6M4E94|Manesha Ramesh>  [6:31 PM]
Hi!! I just started using HubSpot's Design Manager and I am implementing some pages for a website. I would like to make some custom modules from scratch and then a custom template from them. I want to be able to use some third party libraries like vue.js to make the the user interface really dynamic and cool (new to Vue.js too lol). However, I do not want to embed the CDN in each module. Is there a way for me to just import the Vue.js source code (or other third party libraries) for the entire template once and then use it in all the different modules I create for it?
sure, just create a new JS file and paste in the Vue source code, then link to it as a "required file" at the module level, or add it to the global footer HTML section in website settings
